patchlogs.name: Shrine of the Eidolon: Update 22.13.0
patchlogs.changes: Ivara’s Prowl will now only steal from each enemy once total, instead of once per Ivara. Our intent is to mirror how Nekros’ Desecrate also functions, considering the recent movement of Sentient Cores to certain Sentient variants. It’s rewarding to be the warmly welcomed Nekros in an Argon Crystal run, and we hope Ivara will now be welcomed equivalently.

patchlogs.name: Update 14.5: Operation Cryotic Front!
patchlogs.additions: Corpus Ice Planet! Progress with fellow Tenno in the Operation Cryotic Front event to explore the new frozen tundras!
patchlogs.changes:
You see, I have an appetite for the rare and extraordinary and I’ve recently learned of a fine substance known as Cryotic. If you are willing, I will supply the necessary equipment and coordinates for its extraction. In return, I will enlighten you with what I know about technology that could defeat this Balor threat.
Usually found in extreme sub-zero environments, Cryotic instantly freezes anything it comes in contact with.
Operation Cryotic Front is the first introduction of a new mission type that will replace all Survival missions that take place on a terrestrial tileset.
This Operation introduces Cryotic, a new resource that will only be available in the Excavation game mode.
With each successful dig, you will receive an amount of Cryotic based on your performance (100 max.) The more Cryotic you earn, the better the Reward – so dig on!

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 14.0.8

patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Focus ‘Buy Capacity’ button not updating after converting Eidolon Shards into Focus.

patchlogs.name: Shrine of the Eidolon: Update 22.15.0
patchlogs.changes: A special UI message is now displayed when picking up Tellurium, or any of the Eidolon Shards (similar to Argon Crystal).

patchlogs.name: Shrine of the Eidolon: Update 22.12.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Clients not being able to see/pick up the dropped Brilliant Eidolon Shard when a Host Migration occurred and no one had picked it up yet.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Hotfix 22.10.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed UI locking up when attempting to do a Focus Conversion with Eidolon Shards.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Hotfix 22.1.2
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed an unintended issue where players could pick up Eidolon Shards after joining in-progress missions where the Teralyst had already been killed. 
Fixed an issue where Brilliant Eidolon Shards were not properly accounted for in the Focus Conversion screen after used to unlock Way-Bound nodes.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Hotfix 22.0.9
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed an issue where players could trade in Brilliant Eidolon Shards for Endo. Maroo has returned from vacation and is sorry she got some tin-suits in trouble. 
Fixed a UI issue that occurred upon spending Focus while also redeeming Brilliant Eidolon Shards for Focus.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Hotfix 22.0.8
patchlogs.changes: Added the option to redeem Brilliant Eidolon Shards for 25,000 focus each. Redeem for the school of your choice in the appropriate skill tree!

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Hotfix 22.0.7
patchlogs.changes:
Several reduced to 3 Eidolon Shards instead of 5.
Void Shadow no longer costs 40 Eidolon Shards to craft.

patchlogs.name: The Jovian Concord: Update 25.1.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Warframe Rank Bonus UI not resetting when Polarized with a Forma.

patchlogs.name: The Jovian Concord: Hotfix 25.0.8
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed inability to add a Precept Polarity to Venari using Forma.

patchlogs.name: The Jovian Concord: Hotfix 25.0.7
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the map node for Saturn > Telesto displaying a Forma instead of an enemy.

patchlogs.name: The Jovian Concord: Update 25
patchlogs.changes:
More information is directly exposed that removes the requirement to click-through tabs and scroll to find the information you want, such as related Bundles and the quantity of Blueprints owned (ex Forma).
Slightly increased the drop rate of the Seeding Step Ephemera and Aura Forma Blueprint in Arbitrations.
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed ability to use the Aura Forma on Sentinels and Companions.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon Remaster: Update 24.8.0
patchlogs.changes: Also, a new Arbitrations reward has been added: the elusive Aura Forma Blueprint! Craft an Aura Forma to modify an Aura slot on a Warframe to be compatible with any Mod Polarity.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon Remaster: Hotfix 24.6.2 + 24.6.2.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed ability to utilize dual Energy colour without Forma by using ‘Copy Warframe Colors’ to your weapon.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon Remaster: Update 24.6.0
patchlogs.changes:
Fashion Frame just got a little more energetic! We have now added a SECONDARY Energy customization slot in the Arsenal! This is simply a free added bonus when Forma'ing gear. 
All Gear can unlock this once Forma is applied! All non-Forma compatible goods (Syandanas, Etc) have this automatically.

patchlogs.name: Chimera: Update 23.10
patchlogs.changes:
3 x Forma
One important thing to clarify is that the in-game items received on the non-Milestone Days in Daily Tribute system now scale based on the amount of days you have logged on. Endo is an example well documented in the past Workshop, but this also applies to Credits, Booster Durations, Resources, Syndicate Medallions, Relics, and Forma Blueprints.
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed camera being stuck inside Martian Ancient Settlement Rock Formation decoration when attempting to place it too close to the camera in the Dojo. Now moving the camera back should help free you from its rocky embrace.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 18.13.2
patchlogs.fixes:
We've received word from the Lotus that everyone will have 7 days following the launch of 18.13.2 to claim a free Forma via inbox simply by logging in shortly after we launch.
learning to master many Warframes and Weapons in your Arsenal. Take this gift of Forma as a token of my appreciation for your willingness to bend the will of your equipment to suit your needs on the battlefield.
The starting Mod Capacity for your gear (new or Forma'd) is now determined by your Mastery Rank and if an item has an Orokin Reactor or Catalyst installed.
Please note this is a slight deviation of our discussions on how Mastery Rank will reflect gear level, but by affecting capacity it fundamentally enables you to use Mods the moment you get your hands on new gear or Forma an item. Have fun!

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 12.0.2
patchlogs.changes:
Changes to Void Mission Rewards: Capture, Exterminate, and Mobile Defense missions no longer contain Resources/Cores as mission rewards, only Prime Parts, Forma, or a Key.
For Survival and Defense missions, staying at least 15 20 minutes/15 waves guarantees a Prime Part, Forma or a Key. Resources, Cores, or Credits are included in the cycling of mission rewards for Survival/Defense.

patchlogs.name: Warframe Update 22: Plains of Eidolon
patchlogs.additions: It's been almost two years since we released the first version of Focus. Focus comes as a system unlocked upon completion of 'The Second Dream'. After answering a series of questions from The Lotus, you (the Operator) chose a Focus school and began your journey through a series of Passives that you needed to unlock all the while earning the Focus points to do so. Then came The War Within, where your Operator became playable with a few abilities meant mainly to help you earn Kuva and participate in Quests.

patchlogs.changes:
Nidus’ Ravenous Maggots will still attack but no longer latch on other Infested Maggots or Kuva Jesters due to awkward animations.  
In an effort to address the issue of people not noticing the movement of The Kuva Fortress, we have made the loop completion time odd rather than a 24 hour cycle. Players who were logging in around the same daily time found that the Kuva Fortress would always be roughly in the same position, and was restricting the variety of Kuva Siphon missions available.

patchlogs.name: The War Within: 19.1.0 Ash Revisited
patchlogs.changes:
The Kuva Fortress is now eligible for Grineer Sortie mission locations. 
Made some changes to lower level load time in some cases in the Kuva Fortress.
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed Clients being unable to progress through Assault missions on the Kuva Fortress. 
Fixed players getting stuck under elevators in the Kuva Fortress tileset. 
Fixed some effects not replicating for Clients in Kuva Fortress Assault missions.
Fixed issues of long load times in Kuva Fortress Assault missions.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 19.0.4
patchlogs.changes:
Tweaked the placement of Caches in Kuva Fortress Exterminate missions.
Tweaked many aspects of the Kuva Fortress Mobile Defense missions, including removing consoles from some more cramped intermediates and adjusting some layout for procedural generation.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 19.0.3
patchlogs.changes:
Polished aspects of Kuva Fortress Assault missions. Individual markers have been added to shootable targets during the 'destroy the targeting mechanism' phase, and added teleport action under the falling debris so players don't get stuck when it's destroyed.
Kuva Fortress Cache hunting has been moved to Fortress Exterminate missions as it makes more sense for the pacing of the mission demands.
Fixed a confusing minimap marker in the Kuva Fortress tileset.
Fixed 'You picked up a key' transmission on the Kuva Fortress Assault mission playing for all players rather than just the user picking up the key.
Fixed the Grineer Icon on the Kuva Scimitar skin floating.
Kuva Siphon spawning has been disabled in Invasions and Void Fissure missions.
Fixed Kuva Siphons becoming 'frozen' by several Warframe powers, allowing for infinite farming.
Fixed Kuva Siphon progress being wiped during a host migration. Currently host migration will restart the event, but we are looking for 'continue' solutions. 
Fixed Powers affecting Kuva Siphoning.

patchlogs.name: The War Within: Hotfix 19.0.2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed not being able to purchase the Xiphos Kuva Skin.

patchlogs.name: Update 19: The War Within
patchlogs.additions:
Once you've progressed far enough in The War Within to discover The Kuva Fortress, a new region will appear on your Solar Chart!
With this set, we knew we wanted to provide an awe-inspiring entry into the world of the Grineer Queens and Kuva. This set is complete with the latest in graphics enhancements like Volumetric Lighting, and includes some of the first ever Archwing Enemy incorporation into foot missions. Don't forget to aim up, Tenno.
After you complete The War Within, Kuva Siphons may appear on Hard Grineer Environments (Sedna, Kuva Fortress, Uranus). These are side-quests related to the larger goals of the Grineer Empire. You will encounter new enemies here, and be required to use the skills learned in The War Within to prevail.
patchlogs.changes: This chapter tells a story of your patience, our gratitude, and of course some wonderful evolution for the game. We're introducing an awe inspiring and dangerous environment: the Kuva Fortress. We're pushing our engine technology to bring you graphic improvements. We're bringing you a story about your past.

patchlogs.name: Update 17.7
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed Rescue Mission timers disappearing when paused by the Liset’s Air Support.
Fixed the Liset’s Air Support hack disappearing after a Host Migration.
Fixed consoles not flickering for Clients when hacked by Ordis via the Liset’s Air Support.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 17.6.1
patchlogs.changes:
Made some audio and timing adjustments to the Liset’s landing cinematics at the start of Missions on Earth’s Forest tileset.
Adjusted the context action button on the Liset’s Air Support.
The Liset’s Air Support will now also disable any nearby cameras.
The Liset’s Air Support will now pause any timers in Spy and rescue Missions that are active while the beacon is up.
Panels now flicker while Ordis is in control of enemy security systems via the Liset’s Air Support.
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Liset’s Air Support unintentionally disabling doors, making it impossible to complete missions.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 17.5.5

patchlogs.fixes: Fixed an error caused by players installing the Liset’s Incubator Upgrade without having the base Incubator.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 17.4.3
patchlogs.additions: Added a ‘Max Framerate’ option in the Display settings.  This tool will allow players to set a maximum framerate across all of Warframe.  A max framerate can only be set if V-sync is disabled, but doing this will allow players to run the game at 120FPS instead of ~300FPS+ in places such as the Liset.
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the ‘visible when holstered’ option not hiding quivers on certain bows and causing clipping issues of quivers going through the chest when in the Liset.

Fixed not being able to open the chat window in the Liset.

patchlogs.name: Update 17.2.4
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed an issue with the end-of-match screen in the Liset showing PvE gear even after completing PvP missions and using different gear.

patchlogs.name: Update 17.1.0 - 17.1.4

patchlogs.name: Update 16.6.0

New Liset Skins, Alternate Helmet and Augment Mods available now!
Tenno, show your true colors with new Customizations! Give the outside of your Liset some flare with new Skins, style Vauban with a new Alternate Helmet and add power to your Warframes with new Ability Augments Mods.
KOTARA: Cover your Liset in geometric forms inspired by nature’s order with the Kotara Liset Skin.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 16.4.4 + 16.4.4.1
patchlogs.changes: Several Liset Radio Chatter contest winners have been included into the Liset’s audio rotation. Blazingcobalt, jprocks67 and Kalimando all now have their voices featured in game!  Keep an ear out for new transmissions coming straight from community members.

patchlogs.name: Update 16.3: The New Protocols

Increased the amount of decorations that can be placed in the Liset to 40.
Notifications for events shown in the Liset’s Navigation console will now update their time remaining at 24h, 12h, 1h, 30min, 15min, 5m and 0s.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 16.0.4

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 16.0.2

patchlogs.fixes: ·         Fixed Ordis’ ‘idle’ Liset transmissions interrupting other communications.

patchlogs.name: Warframe: Sanctuary
patchlogs.additions: New Ordis transmissions have been added to the Liset!
patchlogs.fixes:
In order to obtain this new Quest, players above Mastery Rank 5 must first visit Cephalon Simaris in his Sanctuary after completing the Stolen Dreams Quest.  From there players can acquire The New Strange and accept it from the Codex once they return to the Liset.
Cephalon Capture is our latest PvP game mode available on the Conclave Console in the Liset, and with its arrival come a slew of new changes to our existing PvP system.  The following are a list of general changes to PvP immediately available in Update: Sanctuary:
Fixed Host getting stuck on a loading screen when returning to Liset from a Mission.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 15.16.2
patchlogs.changes: The Rift Sigil will now fully lit up in Liset/Hub, as there is no energy

patchlogs.name: Update 15.14.0
patchlogs.fixes:
Have some empty space to fill on the Liset dashboard? Good news! New Noggles have arrived in the Market!
Add style so good it's practically toxic with the new Saryn Noggle, distract Liset guests from that mess your Kubrow made with the Ash Noggle, or give your Liset that angry Corpus boss vibe with the Alad V Noggle. The best part? You'll never have to dust them!

patchlogs.name: Update 15.13
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed issue that would cause Mission Results to not appear after completing a Mission and returning to your Liset.

patchlogs.name: Update 15.12.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed issues that could arise when moving from terminal to terminal within the Liset’s quick menu.

patchlogs.name: Update 15.8.0

Liset, Relay)

Each Syndicate has their own room on Tenno Relays, and are more than happy to trade their usual rewards in-person instead of through the Liset’s console.
Fixed player Liset decorations floating in midair in the docking station of the Relay Station.
Fixed Liset Foundry flashing an update for players staying on the Liset during a content Update.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 15.1.3

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 15.1.2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed being able to use weapons while on the Liset, specifically after removing the Grustrag Bolt.

patchlogs.name: Update 15.1.0+15.1.01

patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed the Liset being semi-invisible during the first Archwing Mission end cinematic.
Fixed PBR error that caused black textures to appear on Liset and star map.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 15.0.7
patchlogs.additions: • Improved the performance of multiple UI elements seen on the Liset.

patchlogs.name: Warframe: Archwing
patchlogs.changes:
Learn all about the emerging Syndicates by accessing the “Syndicates” panel in your Liset. This panel is to the left of Navigation!
Liset Decorations (x10)!
Bobbleheads are here! You can buy these and place them in your ship through the pause menu -> Equipment -> Decorate Liset. Placement and removal works similar to Dojo decoration placement.
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed issue with looping Liset ship seen here: https://forums.warframe.com/index.php?/topic/311059-corpus-outpost-extraction-bug-liset-lands-and-lands-again-and-again/#entry3537615
Fixed issues where players can get stuck in certain areas of the Liset if slide jumping aggressively.

Fixed an issue with players having a gray screen when returning to the Liset after a mission failure.

patchlogs.fixes: Fixed issue where the Liset bridge may not lower if you used the quick access menu between locations.

Added in a "Please Wait" message that will lock the player in place when installing a module on your Liset during Vor’s Prize/elsewhere.
Fixed an issue with the Liset seen in the tutorial having no proper collision.

patchlogs.name: Update 14.5: Operation Cryotic Front!
patchlogs.changes: • Kubrows are now in free-roam mode on the Liset!

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 14.2.1

your Liset is now pilot-able on loading screens! .

patchlogs.name: Update 14.1.0: Quanta & Dendra
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed a number of map holes found in the Liset.
Fixed an issue with squad host no longer receiving game invites after entering a mission and then returning to their Liset.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 14.0.8

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 14.0.5
patchlogs.changes:
Added more latency in between Radio Chatter lines on the Liset.
Turned down sound on Liset Floor ramp activating (some call it the in-ship slide).
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Liset Bridge ambience cutting off if you're too close to the window with camera.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 14.0.1
patchlogs.fixes:
Removed the ability to "moonwalk" while on the Liset, while we wanted to ensure people could travel quickly around their ship, we have replaced the jarring movement with a slide.
Fixed an issue with Liset sounds not playing during loading screens.

patchlogs.name: Update 14: The Mad Cephalon
patchlogs.fixes:
Player Ships have arrived! This immersive and re-imagined space grounds players in the Solar System aboard their own personal spacecraft, the Liset!
Introducing: Ordis! The Liset’s Cephalon 
voice and guide! This new character exists as the Liset’s original operating system, and is finally functional and ready to serve the Tenno after hundreds of years of abandon.
The Liset provides access to all major systems, menus, and components through contextual devices aboard your ship. These are unlocked via Vor’s Prize quest! If you are a veteran that chooses to bypass playing the Prologue, they will all be ready and functioning for you.
New Mission Results screen! This new screen shows all the details of your previous run! Its minimalistic appearance will be expanded on as feedback and experiences with Liset form.

patchlogs.name: Octavia's Anthem: Update 20
patchlogs.changes:
Do you hear the music, Tenno? Faint memories of the Mandachord orchestra linger, and Suda wishes you follow it. Do as the Cephalon requests and be rewarded knowledge of an instrument from another time, the Mandachord. But, take caution... following her instructions may lead you down a twisted path...
Compose her song and then conduct the mighty Mandachord, turning bass, beat and melody into an anthem of devastation.
Conduct your very own symphony, Tenno. Octavia’s abilities are powered by the Mandachord, a formidable tool used to mix Melody, Bass, and Percussion into a harmony of destruction. Compose a song before entering the battle by going to your Arsenal, selecting the Appearance tab, and hitting the “Mandachord” button.
In this guide, we will be using the Adau Instruments to get you started on composition since they are the default Mandachord Instruments. There are also 4 other Instruments available in the Market for Platinum if you own Octavia:
Use “Load Song” to select one of your custom songs or one of the default Instrument songs to load into the Mandachord.
Once you have selected a song to share, a link with its title will appear in chat for others to save. Clicking on a song link will give you the following instructions on how to load the song into your own Mandachord:

patchlogs.changes:
Get Octavia today by purchasing her in the Market for Platinum, or by completing Octavia’s Anthem to get her Blueprint. Her parts can be found in the following ways:
A high tempo rifle. Choose between automatic and semi automatic fire to lay waste to your enemies. Its primary fire rewards increased accuracy and fire rate with consistent shooting. Its alt fire will load up 10 ammo before being shot in a single blow. The Tenora can be purchased in the Market for Platinum or researched in the Tenno Lab Dojo room.
This fan hammer pistol, like the Tenora, also has two firing modes. Its semi-automatic primary fire will please sharpshooters. Its alt fire packs a punch (several) by emptying its entire clip in one trigger pull, but hold steady, the shots also have some kick to them. The Pandero can be purchased in the Market for Platinum or you can purchase its Blueprint in the Market for crafting.
For those of you looking for the original Charger model, you can find the Helminth Degenerate Pattern as a Cosmetic Option in the Market available for Credits!
Bleedout Markers now hover above the player’s head and will follow them if they crawl around. A distance label is also added to this Marker (but will disappear when they are being revived).

patchlogs.changes:
Finally, keep an eye out to other UI tweaks that should make your Market experience easier and more accessible! If you want to learn more about these changes, be sure to read our dev workshop:
The Okina are here! This Tenno Sai can be yours today by either visiting the Market to acquire the full weapon, or in your Tenno Lab research!!
Adjusted the Market icon size of the Akstilleto and Ballistica.
patchlogs.fixes:
Void Key Pack from the Market and Daily Tribute has changed to Relic Pack.
Get this Archwing today in the Market or Tenno Clan Research!
The Warframe Market got a facelift! Two big motivators behind this rework are pretty straight-forward: a) to make it easier to find what you want and to see what’s available; and b) to allow the Market to grow as more content is added in-game. Highlights of this upgrade include better item categories (especially for Cosmetics) and a brand new search function to help you fine-tune your results. A new hide/show owned button will make browsing for new gear a breeze, but for those who need to save up for the big ticket items, the new Wishlist feature will help you keep track of your must-haves. Feeling particularly generous? You can see your friends’ Wishlists and gift them what their heart desires!
A large majority of Market-related complaints we receive relate to the confusion between built items (aka Platinum-purchased) and Blueprints. The current Market set-up can misguide players into thinking that Warframes, Weapons, and Sentinels aren’t craftable in-game, so we condensed the Built items and Blueprints into the same page. Information about build costs, stats, blueprint location, and more, will be separated into 3 tabs on this page to help players learn all they need to know about the item in order to make an informed purchase!
While trying to make the Market work (and look!) better, we made some pricing changes as follows:

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 13.2.3
patchlogs.fixes: Helmets with stat modifications have now been removed from the Market/Alert Cycle. Previously crafted or purchased Helmets with stats have been grandfathered in and will not be affected by this change. Additional Stat-to-Stateless Helmet recipes have been added to the Market for individuals wishing to change their current stat modifying helmets to purely cosmetic versions. To coincide with this change, the ability to trade Helmets has been added into the game as well. While the possible options to execute on this change were many, we do not feel comfortable removing the stats outright from gear players have spent hours and hours waiting for via alerts or spent Platinum on. The agency is in the players hand to remove the stats, and we will monitor to decide if further steps need to be taken.

patchlogs.name: Buried Debts: Hotfix 24.5.7
patchlogs.changes: We ran a script Tuesday night that Inboxed respective Syndicate Medallions to those who didn’t receive their Relics.

patchlogs.name: Chimera: Update 23.10
patchlogs.changes: One important thing to clarify is that the in-game items received on the non-Milestone Days in Daily Tribute system now scale based on the amount of days you have logged on. Endo is an example well documented in the past Workshop, but this also applies to Credits, Booster Durations, Resources, Syndicate Medallions, Relics, and Forma Blueprints.

patchlogs.name: The Sacrifice: Update 23

patchlogs.name: Beasts of the Sanctuary: Update 22.20.0

patchlogs.name: Shrine of the Eidolon: Update 22.17.0 + 22.17.0.1

patchlogs.name: Shrine of the Eidolon: Update 22.16.0

patchlogs.name: Shrine of the Eidolon: Hotfix 22.13.3

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Mirage Prime 22.7.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Syndicate Medallion/Sentient Core redemption UI allowing you to redeem a decimal value. Medallions/Cores were never actually redeemed as this was purely a UI issue.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Update 22.2.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Sentient Cores counting towards the Medallion challenge of a "Find x Syndicate Medallions" Riven.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Hotfix 22.0.6 + 22.0.6.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed redeeming more Syndicate Medallions than your daily limit prompting you with a ‘wasting Standing’ message. Redeeming Syndicate Medallions is not affected by your daily cap.

patchlogs.name: Chains of Harrow: Update 21.4.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Syndicate Medallions (and perhaps other booty) spawning inside a wall in the Grineer Forest tileset.

patchlogs.name: Chains of Harrow: Update 21.2.0 + 21.2.0.1

patchlogs.name: Update: Specters of the Rail
patchlogs.additions: Completely revisited old tilesets and added new rare loot spawn points for Syndicate Medallions and more. This should also fix issues with some missions only having 3 or so Syndicate Medallions to collect.

patchlogs.name: Update 18.7.0
patchlogs.fixes: •    Fixed Red Veil Marks (Medallions) not glowing red in missions.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 18.0.6 + 18.0.6.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed an unreachable rare Syndicate Medallion spawn location on the Infested Corpus ship tileset.

patchlogs.name: Update 17.2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed an issue that would cause Syndicate Medallions to lose their ‘glow’ when certain abilities are used nearby, making them very difficult to see.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 17.1.5
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed some potential issues with Medallions being invisible in missions.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 17.0.4
patchlogs.changes: Mag’s Greedy Pull Augment Mod will no longer pull Syndicate Medallions.

patchlogs.name: Update 17: Echoes Of The Sentient
patchlogs.changes: Increased the total number of Loot Crates and Syndicate Medallions spawned in Missions.

patchlogs.name: Update 16.9.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Syndicate Medallions becoming invisible during Syndicate Missions

patchlogs.name: Update 16.8.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Syndicate Medallions being invisible as per : https://forums.warframe.com/index.php?/topic/473021-invisible-syndicate-medallions/

patchlogs.name: Update 16.2
patchlogs.fixes: Players will no longer be able to keep Syndicate Medallions found during a Mission if the Mission is not completed.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 16.0.2
patchlogs.fixes: ·         Fixed material on Steel Meridian Medallions not displaying correctly.

patchlogs.name: Warframe: Sanctuary
patchlogs.changes: 8 Syndicate Medallions are now guaranteed to appear in any Syndicate Mission.

patchlogs.name: Update 15.15 + 15.15.01
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed inaccessible Rare Loot Crates and Syndicate Medallions on Grineer Spy Missions.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 15.13.8
patchlogs.changes: Crossfire Syndicate Missions will still have Medallions available for pickup.
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed an issue causing Syndicate Missions to behave like normal Crossfire Missions, in addition to featuring no Medallions.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 15.13.1
patchlogs.fixes:
* Defense and Interception Syndicate Missions are now worth 50% more Standing, due to a lack of Medallions in this Mission type.
* Fixed players being unable to redeem Syndicate Medallions.

patchlogs.name: Update 15.13
patchlogs.additions:
Syndicate Leaders and Medallion turn-in representatives have been given idle animations.
Loot waypoints can now be set for Syndicate Medallions, Oberon Blueprints and Stalker weapon Blueprints.  These waypoint markers will be much clearer in what you’re alerting your squadmates of.
patchlogs.changes:
Syndicate Medallions have been increased to provide 500, 1000 or 5000 Standing depending on Medallion rarity.
Syndicate Mission Medallions have new standing values:
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Syndicate Medallion count inappropriately resetting after death.  The counter will now always be clear as to how many Medallions are left in a mission.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 15.10.2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed instances where players became unable to move after picking up Syndicate Medallions or other interactable objects.

patchlogs.name: Update 15.7.2 + 15.7.2.1
patchlogs.changes:
Joining a Syndicate Mission mid-progress will now show how many Medallions are remaining in the Mission, updating appropriately if Medallions in the Mission have already been picked up.
Added confirmation message with all standing changes when turning in Medallions.
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed host migration issues occurring when picking up Syndicate Medallions.
Fixed Syndicate Medallions disappearing during a host migration.
Fixed players being unable to pick up a Syndicate Medallion until another player in the mission picked it up first.
Fixed broken lighting effects on Syndicate Medallions.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 15.6.2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Medallions not appearing in Syndicate Daily Missions.

patchlogs.name: Update 15.6.0
patchlogs.fixes:
Syndicate rooms each have a special representative that collects Medallions, a new Currency for earning Standing.
Medallions are now available on Syndicate Missions.  Medallions act like their own currency, similar to Credits.  Each Syndicate’s Medallion may have their own unique look, but regardless of their appearance all Medallions count toward the same currency pool: Standing!
When you’re ready to turn in Medallions simply head to your Tenno Relay of choice, visit your Syndicate trader and select how many you wish to turn in.  Different ranks of Medallions can provide greater Standing than others; so keep an eye out for Medallions and plan ahead when you spend them, Tenno.

patchlogs.name: Chimera: Hotfix 23.10.2
patchlogs.fixes: We have live fixed Arbitration missions rewarding the incorrect amount of Vitus Essence at End Of Mission, and inability to complete the Mastery Rank 26 test.

name: Void Traces
description:
A substance used to increase the power within Relics.
Can be acquired from Void Fissures.

patchlogs.name: The Jovian Concord: Hotfix 25.1.1
patchlogs.changes:
Added Alias’ (both yours and squadmates) to the Reward selection screen so that it’s clear who is picking which Reward (yourself included) and where the bonus Void Traces are going.
Moved the Void Traces information to be directly below the Refinement options for better visibility in the Refinement screen.

patchlogs.name: The Jovian Concord: Update 25
patchlogs.changes: Increased the base amount of Void Traces granted when your Relic is chosen from 1 to 5.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Hotfix 22.1.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Void Traces not being obtained if the last Reactant you pick up is with your Operator.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Hotfix 22.0.7
patchlogs.changes: Higher level bounties will offer Kuva and Void Traces.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Hotfix 22.0.3
patchlogs.changes: Removed Ayatan Stars and Uncommon Resources from High Level Bounties and replaced with 100x Void Traces. Low Level Bounties will continue to have rewards that target interests of a newer player who might not have some Mods that veterans do.

patchlogs.name: The Silver Grove: U3 Ayatan
patchlogs.additions: The Void is now an eligible region for Alerts! Alerts that occur in the Void will have a chance to include Void Traces as a reward!

patchlogs.name: Specters of the Rail: Hotfix 13
patchlogs.changes: Void Traces cap is now Mastery Rank based (100 + 50 * MR).

patchlogs.name: Specters of the Rail: Hotfix 1
patchlogs.changes: Tweaked the visuals of Void Traces.

patchlogs.name: Update: Specters of the Rail
patchlogs.fixes:
Void Traces: Raw Void energy that drops in the process of uniting Relics and Fissures. Can be used to Refine Void Relics to yield more rare rewards in your Orbiter.
EXCEPTIONAL = 25 Void Traces
FLAWLESS = 50 Void Traces
RADIANT = 100 Void Traces

patchlogs.name: Warframe Update 22: Plains of Eidolon

patchlogs.name: Specters of the Rail: U1.1

patchlogs.name: Update: Specters of the Rail
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Client Xiphos’ Sentry Guns Air Support Charges remaining in mission even if the Client has aborted. Sentry Guns will now be removed if the Client has left the mission.

patchlogs.changes: Increase delays on Xiphos turret to reduce the constant start/stop behavior that can occur when it's switching targets.

patchlogs.name: Update 18.6

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 18.5.5 + 18.5.5.1
patchlogs.fixes:
•    Fixed Xiphos’ Sentry Turret not being removed when the player who casted it leaves the game.
•    Fixed Xiphos’ Sentry Turret disappearing when a Host Migration occurred.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 18.5.1

patchlogs.name: Fortuna: Hotfix 24.1.3 + 24.1.3.1
patchlogs.changes: Enthrall can now be used while on Ziplines.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Update 22.10.0
patchlogs.changes: Warframe Specters are now much smarter! If you don't recall, Specters are craftable gear you can equip to summon an AI companion in battle. We've done a general intelligence pass on their proficiency with Weapons, and we've also updated their power-casting logic. Virtually every power is now castable with only a few exceptions! Specters CANNOT cast the following Abilities: Vauban's Minelayer, Ivara's Zipline, Titania's Razorwing, Nekros’ Desecrate and Shadows of the Dead, Excalibur’s Exalted Blade, Valkyr’s Hysteria, Wukong’s Primal Fury, Cloud Walker, and Defy, Atlas’ Petrify and Tectonics, Limbo's entire kit (save for the damage aspect of Banish), and finally Zephyr’s Dive Bomb.
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed an issue where dying on a Zipline would allow you to run around in a 'Revive' state.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Update 22.6.0 + Hotfix 22.6.0.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed being unable to use Ivara’s Zipline in one of the Grineer camps in the Plains.

patchlogs.name: Banshee Prime: Hotfix 19.11.5 + 19.11.6
patchlogs.changes: “Use Zip Line” context action is now attached to and scales with the cable you wish to use.

patchlogs.name: Update: Specters of the Rail
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed possible enemy location desync issues between Host and Client for enemies on Ziplines

patchlogs.name: Update 17.5: The Jordas Precept. + Hotfix 17.5.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed general issues on Zipline parkour movement.

patchlogs.name: Update 6 - "New Stompin’ Grounds"
patchlogs.additions: Zip-lines – take on foes while ziplining across the more open spaces of the Grineer set!
